item.title: Jim add a quote by Clifton Fadiman
item.description: "To take wine into our mouths is to savor a droplet of the river of human history" -- Clifton Fadiman

item.title: Jim add a quote by Paul Tillich
item.description: "Wine is like the incarnation--it is both divine and human" -- Paul Tillich

item.title: Jim add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Give me wine to wash me clean of the weather-stains of cares" -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Jim add a quote by Homer
item.description: "Wine can of their wits the wise beguile, Make the sage frolic, and the serious smile" -- Homer

item.title: Jim add a quote by Martin Luther
item.description: "Beer is made by men, wine by God." -- Martin Luther

item.title: Jim add a quote by D. H. Lawrence
item.description: "If we sip the wine, we find dreams coming upon us out of the imminent night" -- D. H. Lawrence

item.title: Jim add a quote by Clifton Fadiman
item.description: "A bottle of wine begs to be shared; I have never met a miserly wine lover" -- Clifton Fadiman

item.title: Jim add a quote by Andre Simon
item.description: "Wine makes every meal an occasion, every table more elegant, every day more civilized." -- Andre Simon

item.title: Jim add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "I've learned that you can tell a lot about a person by the way (s)he handles these three things: a rainy day, lost luggage, and tangled Christmas tree lights." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Jim add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "History with all its unending pain cannot be outlived, but faced with courage need not be lived again." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Jim add a quote by Edward Steinberg
item.description: "Great wine works wonders and is itself one" -- Edward Steinberg

item.title: Jim add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "I am a firm believer in the people. If given the truth, they can be depended upon to meet any national crisis. The great point is to bring them the real facts, and beer." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Jim add a quote by W.C. Fields
item.description: "I cook with wine, sometimes I even add it to the food." -- W.C. Fields

item.title: Jim add a quote by Socrates
item.description: "The unexamined life is not worth living." -- Socrates

item.title: Jim add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "A human being should be able to change a diaper, plan an invasion, butcher a hog, conn a ship, design a building, write a sonnet, balance accounts, build a wall, set a bone, comfort the dying, take orders, give orders, cooperate, act alone, solve equations, analyze a new problem, pitch manure, program a computer, cook a tasty meal, fight efficiently, die gallantly. Specialization is for insects." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Jim add a quote by Martin Niemöller
Jim add a quote by Hermann Göring
item.description: "Naturally, the common people don't want war; neither in Russia nor in England nor in America nor, for that matter, in Germany. That is understood. But, after all, it is the leaders of the country who determine the policy and it is always a simple matter to drag the people along, whether it is a democracy or a fascist dictatorship or a Parliament or a Communist dictatorship. ... [V]oice or no voice, the people can always be brought to the bidding of the leaders. That is easy. All you have to do is tell them they are being attacked and denounce the pacifists for lack of patriotism and exposing the country to danger. It works the same way in any country." -- Hermann Göring

item.title: Jim add a quote by Christopher Hitchens
item.description: "That which can be asserted without evidence, can be dismissed without evidence." -- Christopher Hitchens

item.title: Jim add a quote by Dwight D. Eisenhower
item.description: "Every gun that is made, every warship launched, every rocket fired signifies in the final sense, a theft from those who hunger and are not fed, those who are cold and are not clothed. This world in arms is not spending money alone. It is spending the sweat of its laborers, the genius of its scientists, the hopes of its children. This is not a way of life at all in any true sense. Under the clouds of war, it is humanity hanging on a cross of iron." -- Dwight D. Eisenhower
